text:
From the AUS Group

_Q&A Session with the Betfair Commercial Director starts now and we have a surprise guest host! The invite link to the zoom is here: <https://us06web.zoom.us/j/83788435450>_

elements.text: From the AUS Group
Q&A Session with the Betfair Commercial Director starts now and we have a surprise guest host! The invite link to the zoom is here:

text: Was <@UBS7QANF3> the surprise guest host?

user_profile.real_name: Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon Jon
user_profile.name: fcmisc

elements.text: Was
the surprise guest host?

text: I don't think the Australian community care for me

elements.text: I don't think the Australian community care for me

text: Why is that?

elements.text: Why is that?

text: they dont like the truth

elements.text: they dont like the truth

text: They think we're not a very welcoming community and I feel somewhat responsible for that

elements.text: They think we're not a very welcoming community and I feel somewhat responsible for that

text: What about it in particular ?

elements.text: What about it in particular ?

text: Oh dear - is that because of some of the responses to our old pal Misha?

elements.text: Oh dear - is that because of some of the responses to our old pal Misha?

text: I think partly that yeah

elements.text: I think partly that yeah

text: Thin skin then. If you talk bollocks and put yourself out there, you should expect "honesty" in reply. I'd take a harsh reality check over hand-wavey bullshit optimism any day of the week. But then again I am often called Victor Meldrew by my friends...

elements.text: Thin skin then. If you talk bollocks and put yourself out there, you should expect "honesty" in reply. I'd take a harsh reality check over hand-wavey bullshit optimism any day of the week. But then again I am often called Victor Meldrew by my friends...

text: He did chat some utter shit and deserved to be called out given his (supposed) experience. But I think we/I can sometimes be too quick to shoot down dissenting opinion (looking at you never green guys)

elements.text: He did chat some utter shit and deserved to be called out given his (supposed) experience. But I think we/I can sometimes be too quick to shoot down dissenting opinion (looking at you never green guys)

text: Important to distinguish opinion from fact though. If you know that greening is usually -EV but do it anyway to smooth the profit curve then that is down to the individual. But the trigger point for me was when he was preaching that for any point in time there is more than one 0 EV price - that kind of thing has to be pounced on.

elements.text: Important to distinguish opinion from fact though. If you know that greening is usually -EV but do it anyway to smooth the profit curve then that is down to the individual. But the trigger point for me was when he was preaching that for any point in time there is more than one 0 EV price - that kind of thing has to be pounced on.

text: I think in general this group is pretty friendly - look at <@U01PJ5YMFBJ> - he asked loads and loads of questions and people were very helpful to him. For me, that aspect should determine how user friendly a community is.

elements.text: I think in general this group is pretty friendly - look at
- he asked loads and loads of questions and people were very helpful to him. For me, that aspect should determine how user friendly a community is.

text: I think this group has done a good job in educating many in how you make money in this game when it comes to ev, I now regularly see posts on the BA forum about EV/not greening etc. 4/5 years ago this was non existent

elements.text: I think this group has done a good job in educating many in how you make money in this game when it comes to ev, I now regularly see posts on the BA forum about EV/not greening etc. 4/5 years ago this was non existent

text: It's really interesting to see different people's attitudes to how to use the community and what their strategy is to get the best from it.

elements.text: It's really interesting to see different people's attitudes to how to use the community and what their strategy is to get the best from it.

text:
I agree with everything you guys are saying while standing by my comments. Without interrogating some members of the Australian Slack community I don't know exactly what specific experiences have given rise to our reputation but I don't think it's exclusively Misha's (deserved) treatment. Personally I think there's something to take away from their comments and I have tried to be more patient and accepting of new discussions

Or maybe they're just all snowflakes

elements.text:

Without interrogating some members of the Australian Slack community I don't know exactly what specific experiences have given rise to our reputation but I don't think it's exclusively Misha's (deserved) treatment. Personally I think there's something to take away from their comments and I have tried to be more patient and accepting of new discussions

Or maybe they're just all snowflakes

text: Ive gained hugely from the help here and the contacts made. Tips from <@UBS7QANF3> <@UGV299K6H> <@U4H19D1D2> and <@UEA14GBRR> have all been key to becoming profitable, I'm currently +£6k for the year. But it's darn hard work! Im sure i spout utter rubbish half the time still, but at least it's not all the time like it was a year ago!!

text: For long running tasks such as market recorders, do you guys ever experience outages or does AWS /cloud platform of choice handle live migration gracefully and flumine keeps running?

elements.text: For long running tasks such as market recorders, do you guys ever experience outages or does AWS /cloud platform of choice handle live migration gracefully and flumine keeps running?

text: Im guessing you are referring to betfair au community forums..

elements.text: Im guessing you are referring to betfair au community forums..

text: I think it's called betfair quants or something..?

elements.text: I think it's called betfair quants or something..?

text: I don't have problems with AWS EC2

elements.text: I don't have problems with AWS EC2

text:
Let’s say one refactors market recorder and need to update containers, what is the best way to terminate old instances and bring up new ones without causing any blips in data recording?
this is typically very stable code but still curious how 100% uptime can be achieved

elements.text:
Let’s say one refactors market recorder and need to update containers, what is the best way to terminate old instances and bring up new ones without causing any blips in data recording?
this is typically very stable code but still curious how 100% uptime can be achieved

text: yeah this is a limitation and not really preventable (as far as I am aware)

elements.text: yeah this is a limitation and not really preventable (as far as I am aware)

text: I recently received an email from AWS about one of my EC2s failing, so I had to manually stop and restart it. Apparently if I'd had Auto Recovery or Auto Scaling this would have been handled automatically, but I guess the current data might still have been lost.

elements.text: I recently received an email from AWS about one of my EC2s failing, so I had to manually stop and restart it. Apparently if I'd had Auto Recovery or Auto Scaling this would have been handled automatically, but I guess the current data might still have been lost.

text: <@UBS7QANF3> how`s the book going?

elements.text: how`s the book going?

text: <@U012XEYK2FJ> I had a similar message too, though it turned out to be a networking issue interrupting external access EC2 instance that they resolved without them or me having to touch the affected server, and there was no interruption to my data collection.

elements.text: I had a similar message too, though it turned out to be a networking issue interrupting external access EC2 instance that they resolved without them or me having to touch the affected server, and there was no interruption to my data collection.

text: I'm Australian and I like your style Mo

elements.text: I'm Australian and I like your style Mo

text: Cheers <@UNQGKT0CR>

elements.text: Cheers

text: It's just a bit of British banter. Fuckem.

elements.text: It's just a bit of British banter. Fuckem.

text: I've been thinking about this recently as I have some small gaps in my recorded data from times when I've rebooted (following a login message from Ubuntu) and/or I've made some code changes that required a marketrecorder stop/start. The only way I can think of at present would be to setup 2 low cost instances and run both in parallel, but its probably more sensible to simply schedule reboots, etc for quiet/off peak times.

elements.text: I've been thinking about this recently as I have some small gaps in my recorded data from times when I've rebooted (following a login message from Ubuntu) and/or I've made some code changes that required a marketrecorder stop/start. The only way I can think of at present would be to setup 2 low cost instances and run both in parallel, but its probably more sensible to simply schedule reboots, etc for quiet/off peak times.

text: Wow, every year he doubles his prices :rolling_on_the_floor_laughing:

elements.text: Wow, every year he doubles his prices

text: Unfortunately, I don't think I'll ever meet someone who has taken the 'course' to tell me how it is and kill my curiosity, I could bet that basically students will need a satellite dishe and prefer to have a ping below 15ms to scalp markets with liquidity, a bit of market manipulation to force weak odds with large amounts of money, lay low odds at the end of games...
